channel.title: [PI] Adding Customs
channel.description: Ok, i am new to adding customs to rsps but i want to know how to.. Just to start off easy i want to know how to add a death cape. Can anyone help?

item.title: [PI] Adding Customs
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“DaMatt17, post:6, topic:433075”]Realistic 06-07 server (Remakes) is hot now.
Though having a server with custom items can be cool aslong as their models look good.
Now, let’s stop discussing about this stuff because it’s going off-topic ;)[/quote]

forsure. just a bit…

On topic: In my opinion, useing Delta to add customs is easier, all you have to do is open up the class8.java, paste in the ints, and go to the raw modes, and dump the .dat files there. WAAAY easiter than PI…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Adding Customs
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“DaMatt17, post:4, topic:433075”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=535796.msg3917341#msg3917341 date=1329342029]
i personally dont think you should add customs, it ruins the server. If you do decide to STILL add them, dont make them over powered or too expensive. That will kill your eco.
[/quote]

He’s probably new to coding servers because he doesn’t know how to add customs.
Every new coder loves customs and a lot of custom content, though later more experienced coders decide to make a more realistic server.[/quote]

haha when i started, 508 servers were new, and all i added was customs, haha i had like 500+ customs and re-colors. Now i only code classic 317’s…

Point being, adding the customs, and correct ints are a good way to pratice things, but will make you realize how little a gold bandos chest plate is needed in a server.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Adding Customs
item.dc:creator: @DaMatt17 DaMatt17
item.description:
@DaMatt17 wrote:

First download another server [PI] and search for Itemdef.java/Itemdef2.java in your client.
Then, search for death cape, find the model’s ids, open the cache and drag the models to your client’s cache.
Copy the code from Itemdef/Itemdef2 and paste it in your client’s itemdef/itemdef2.

That works for me, make sure the model’s ids aren’t too high(50000+)

Read full topic
